config.question: How did the advent of evangelicalism affect American society?

choices.content: It gave rise to the formation of many competing churches.
It gave people new faith in ministers and institutions.
It offered a pessimistic and deterministic view of the future.
It discouraged political apathy in favor of spiritual growth.

answer_3.response: The Great Awakening encouraged men and women who had been taught to remain silent before traditional authority figures to speak up, to take an active role in their salvation. They could no longer rely on ministers or institutions. The individual alone stood before God. Knowing this, New Lights shattered the old harmony among Protestant sects. In its place, they introduced a noisy, often bitter competition.
